intro: Dianthus siculus, commonly known as the Sicilian carnation, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in early summer and are often used in ornamental gardening due to their vibrant appearance. Dianthus siculus is also valued for its historical use in traditional medicine.
